1.text: And when they draw near to Jerusalem, to Bethphage and Bethany, to the mount of Olives, he sends two of his disciples,

2.text: And says to them, Retire into the town over against you: and quickly going into it, ye shall find a colt tied, upon which none of men has sat; having loosed, bring him.

3.text: And if any say to you, Why do ye this? say ye that the Lord has need of him; and quickly will he send him here.

4.text: And they went away, and found the colt tied to the door without by the road, and they loose him.

5.text: And certain standing there said to them, What do ye, loosing the colt?

6.text: And they said as Jesus charged them: and they let them go.

7.text: And they brought the colt to Jesus, and they cast their garments upon him, and he sat upon him.

8.text: And many strewed their garments in the way: and others cut down branches from the trees, and strewed in the way.

9.text: And they going before, and they following, cried, saying, Osanna; praised he coming in the name of the Lord:

10.text: Praised the kingdom coming in the name of the Lord of our father David: Osanna in the highest ones.

11.text: And Jesus came into Jerusalem, and into the temple: and having looked around upon all things, the hour being already coming, he went into Bethany with the twelve.

12.text: And in the morrow, they having come from Bethany, he hungered:

13.text: And having seen a fig tree afar off having leaves, he came, if yet he shall find any thing upon it; and having come to it, he found nothing except leaves; for it was not time of the figs.

14.text: And Jesus having answered, said to it, May none eat more fruit of thee forever. And his disciples heard.

15.text: And they come to Jerusalem: and Jesus having entered into the temple, began to cast out those selling and buying in the temple; and the tables of the money-changers, and the seats of those selling doves he overturned;

16.text: And he permitted not that any should bring a vessel through the temple.

17.text: And he taught, saying to them, Has it not been written, That my house shall be called the house of prayer to all nations? and ye made it a den of robbers.

18.text: And the scribes and chief priests heard, and they sought how they might destroy him: for they feared him, for all the crowd were struck with amazement at his teaching.

19.text: And when it was evening, he went without the city.

20.text: And in the morning, coming near, they saw the fig tree having been dried up from the roots.

21.text: And Peter, having recalled to mind, says to him, Rabbi, behold, the fig tree which thou cursedst is dried up.

22.text: And Jesus having answered, says to them, Have the faith of God.

23.text: For truly I say to you, That whoever should say to this mountain, Be thou removed, and be thou cast into the sea; and should not discuss in his heart, but believe that what he says, is; it shall be to him, whatever he should say.

24.text: For this I say to you, All things whatever, praying, ye ask, believe that ye receive, and it shall be to you.

25.text: And when ye stand praying, let go, if ye have any thing against any one: that also your Father, he in the heavens, might let go to you your falls.

26.text: And if ye do not let go, neither will your Father, he in the heavens, let go your falls.

27.text: And they come again to Jerusalem: and he walking in the temple, the chief priests, and scribes, and elders come to him,

28.text: And say to him, By what power doest thou these things? and who gave thee this power that thou doest these things?

29.text: And Jesus having answered, said to them, And I will ask you one word, and answer ye me, and I will tell you by what power I do these things.

30.text: Was the immersion of John from heaven, or from men? answer me.

31.text: And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we say, From heaven; he will say, Wherefore did ye not believe him.

32.text: But if we say, of men; they feared the people: for all held John, that he was truly a prophet.

33.text: And having answered they say to Jesus, We know not. And Jesus having answered, says to them, Neither say I to you by what power I do these things.
